channel.title: blogdown on Dr. Mowinckel's
channel.description: Recent content in blogdown on Dr. Mowinckel's

item.title: Adding giscus to your blogdown site
item.description: This is going to be a short one. I have been wanting to change my comment section from disqus to utterances for a long while, but have been postponing. Or procrastinating… with me, its usually the latter. I’m not going to go into details of why I wanted to move away from disqus, others have written better about it that I ever could. I was procrastinating mainly because it felt like a little much to figure out utterances too, and the idea of using GitHub issues for comments felt awkward.

item.title: Changing your Blogdown Workflow
item.description: title: “{{ replace .TranslationBaseName “-” " " | title }}” author: Dr. Mowinckel date: {{ .Date }} draft: true output: html_document: keep_md: yes always_allow_html: true tags: [] image: index_files/ title: “R-package Projects” weight: 10 output: html_document: keep_md: yes slug: “changing-you-blogdown-workflow” aliases: ‘/blog/2020-05-25-changing-you-blogdown-workflow’ For more than a year now I have avoided updating my hugo-version on netlify and updating my theme because there was a lot of work that needed to be done to make that happen.
